solution:
```python
import sys
import math

N = 14
INF = 1e9

def f(x, y):
    return x * 100 + y

def g(x, y):
    return x * 100 + y + 1

def calc(p, q, r, s):
    return p * (1 - q) + r * q + s * q

def solve():
    n = int(input())
    a = [0] * (n + 1)
    r = [0] * (n + 1)
    p = [0] * (n + 1)
    s = [0] * (n + 1)
    for i in range(1, n + 1):
        a[i], r[i], p[i], s[i] = map(int, input().split())
    dp = [[0.0] * (n + 1) for _ in range(1 << n)]
    for i in range(1, n + 1):
        dp[1 << (i - 1)][i] = 1.0
    for mask in range(1, 1 << n):
        for i in range(1, n + 1):
            if not (mask & (1 << (i - 1))):
                continue
            for j in range(1, n + 1):
                if j == i:
                    continue
                if not (mask & (1 << (j - 1))):
                    continue
                p1 = calc(r[i], r[j], p[j], s[j])
                p2 = calc(r[i], p[j], r[j], s[j])
                p3 = calc(r[i], s[j], r[j], p[j])
                p4 = calc(p[i], r[j], s[j], s[j])
                p5 = calc(p[i], s[j], r[j], r[j])
                p6 = calc(p[i], s[j], s[j], p[j])
                p7 = calc(s[i], r[j], r[j], p[j])
                p8 = calc(s[i], p[j], s[j], r[j])
                p9 = calc(s[i], s[j], p[j], r[j])
                dp[mask][i] += (p1 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] + p2 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] +
                                p3 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] + p4 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] +
                                p5 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] + p6 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] +
                                p7 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] + p8 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j] +
                                p9 * dp[mask ^ (1 << (i - 1))][j]) / 100.0
    ans = 0.0
    for i in range(1, n + 1):
        ans += dp[(1 << n) - 1][i] / (n - 1)
    print(ans)

solve()
```
